item.title: Analyst, Valuation & Analytics
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

Oxford is seeking an analyst to join our Valuations & Analytics team in Toronto, Canada. Oxford’s Valuations & Analytics team is responsible for real estate valuations, portfolio and property performance and risk analysis across all markets that Oxford invests. The Analyst’s primary responsibilities include building and maintaining Oxford valuation models on a quarterly and annual basis. The candidate for this position will be exposed to the valuation and asset management analytics of investment properties across Oxford’s global portfolio.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Create and update valuation models primarily using Argus Enterprise;
  • Once per year, participate in the creation of Argus models to reflect the new operating budgets for each property, review and collate all new NOI and values for the portfolio;
  • Once per quarter, input all necessary updates for valuation models, including leasing and market assumptions as required;
  • Prepare annual written valuation reports;
  • Conduct analysis in support of Oxford’s Real Estate Management team for the impact on property values for various leasing and capital investment decisions;
  • Assist with internal and external appraisal processes;
  • Liaise with accountants, asset managers, leasing and property management groups in data collection for periodic valuation updates;
  • Data gathering and analysis to support assumptions used in valuations models;
  • Conduct market and economic research, assemble and interpret macro-market trends; and
  • Maintain database on valuation trends and parameters in various markets across Canada, the US, Europe and Asia.

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Relevant undergraduate or advanced degree, including Commerce, Finance, Real Estate or Urban Planning;
  • 0-2 years of fill-time work experience;
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel (financial modeling) is required;
  • Current enrollment or demonstrated interest in pursuing AACI, CFA or CBV designation is desirable;
  • Prior work experience in a real estate company, appraisal or asset management firm, or a professional real estate advisory firm an asset;
  • Knowledge and experience with ARGUS Enterprise considered an asset;
  • Knowledge and experience with data visualization or business intelligence software is considered an asset;
  • Self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a high level of attention to detail;
  • Strong leadership, interpersonal, verbal and written communication, problem solving  and project management skills;
  • Ability to work well under pressure with multiple competing deadlines;
  • Flexible attitude towards a variety of work tasks as is required in a small working group,
  • Work effectively in a team environment and independently as required; and
  • Valid Passport for International travel as needed

To ensure your application is submitted to our applicant tracking system accurately, please follow the instructions below.

Please include all required documents (Resume, Cover Letter) in one combined file. Your application may be submitted in PDF of Microsoft Word format.

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Information Risk & Compliance Analyst
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

We are looking for a motivated Information Risk and Compliance Analyst to join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics (DNA) team within OMERS\' Data & Technology. DNA applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable and appropriately governed solutions that drive sustainable growth at OMERS.

In this role, you will will develop and nurture strong relationships with key governance partners (including Risk, Compliance, Audit, Legal, Privacy, Cybersecurity) and OMERS business units to identify applicable laws, regulations and industry standards governing the handling of records and data.  You will also develop, implement and maintain key processes and controls for complying with those requirements, such as data retention and disposition processes. In doing so, you will directly strengthen our compliance practices, manage risks to our organization and help optimize the ability of data to support a diverse array of global business functions.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Understanding the function, location and ownership of records/data across the OMERS enterprise and updating inventories, metadata repositories and other tools necessary to enable an enterprise-wide retention and disposition program.
  • Researching laws, rules and regulations impacting the records retention, including the duration, location and manner for keeping records across in legal jurisdictions from across the globe.
  •  Maintaining a network of business area representatives with accountability and ownership for records retention and disposition decision-making, as well as points of contact for records/data inquiries and issue resolution requests.
  • Developing and maintain procedures and workflow processes necessary to support efficient, compliant management of records and data in line with best practices, laws and regulations.
  • Working with information management and technology team members to implement a new Enterprise Data Retention Standard by applying retention categories and rules in electronic content management solutions and structured data systems.
  • Coordinating a legally defensible data disposition program applicable to physical records, electronic documents and structured data.
  • Apply record hold and discovery processes in response to litigation, claims, audits, investigations, personal information access requests and other legal proceedings.
  • Developing and implementing an Enterprise Archives program, including establishment of archival selection criteria for physical records, electronic content and structured data.
  • Drive a culture of compliance, risk management and innovation by delivering records and data-related training, awareness and enablement programs.

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Degree or diploma in Archives, Information Studies, Library and Information Science, Law, Compliance or Policy Management AND/OR relevant professional certification, such as Certified Records Manager (CRM), Certified Records Analyst (CRA) or Information Governance Professional (IGP).
  • 3-5 years experience developing and implementing records/data retention, disposition and archival preservation controls.
  • Solid grasp of records/data retention, disposition, legal holds, archival preservation, content management systems and information governance standards and best practices.
  • Experience identifying and assessing legal/regulatory requirements impacting the handling of records and data.
  • Experience using and applying data and information governance controls to electronic systems, such as structured databases, electronic records management systems and content management systems.
  • Ability to build relationships and facilitate discussion across a diverse group of stakeholders from different business units.
  • Demonstrated experience in project and time management.
  • Advanced analytical skills, including the ability to interpret and apply complex legal language, industry standards and policy statements.
  • Polished written communication and dynamic presentation skills targeted at all levels of the organization.
  • Experience automating or enhancing records and data management processes through the use of technology is an asset.
  • Experience working in the finance, pensions, investments or commercial real estate sectors is an asset.

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

item.title: Analyst, Asset Management
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

Oxford is seeking an Analyst to join our Retail Asset Management team in Toronto. This position supports the retail leasing and operating teams in a collaborative effort to focus on driving asset values and investment returns. The Retail Asset Management group is principally responsible for maximizing returns and asset values, managing co-ownership relationships, developing asset management plans for each retail asset and capital expenditure management. The Analyst will be primary responsible for providing analytical support and will gain exposure to all facets of the retail asset management business including leasing, operations, development and investments.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
• Leading a collaborative effort including key internal and external stakeholders to update the Retail Asset Management Plans and Strategic Investment Plans on an annual basis and develop tools to track performance against plan. The Retail Asset Management Plans set the vision, short/mid/long-term goals, outline strategic objectives and opportunities, and outline accountability and dates for deliverables
• Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to maximize returns and asset value by driving NOI including leading analysis on key leasing transactions, reinvestment opportunities, and significant expense management initiatives
• Develop and improve on existing reporting provided to co-owners
• Develop high value-add reporting including in-depth analysis for retailer sales performance, GROC ratios, Common Area Maintenance and Tax charges and benchmarking across Oxford assets and the retail industry
• Gain understanding of co-owner return hurdles, reporting requirements, investment goals, etc. and develop processes, tools and reporting to enhance the co-owner relationship
• Capital Expenditure Management: Provide analytical support in strategizing and prioritizing capital expenditure spending in conjunction with the retail asset management plans
• Work collaboratively with the Retail Research team to drive the implementation, utilization and monetization of Oxford’s retail analytics data to support Leasing, Operations and Marketing efforts
• Participating in process improvement initiatives related to monthly/quarterly reporting and creation of data analytics dashboards
• Providing support on various ad-hoc analysis tasks including but not limited to major leasing and capital investment decisions, tenant financial performance summaries, drawing insights from historical and budgeted property-level financials, etc.
• Assisting the Asset Management team in the monitoring of operating and leasing targets as part of the annual budget process



To succeed in this role, you have:
• Undergraduate degree in Commerce, Finance, Real Estate, Urban Planning, or Engineering
• 2 years of work experience in real estate (asset management, leasing, investments or development)
• Experience working for a real estate company, appraisal or asset management firm, or a professional real estate advisory firm is considered a strong asset
• Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, knowledge of ARGUS DCF and familiarity with ARGUS Enterprise is considered an asset
• Self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a high level of attention to detail
• Strong leadership, interpersonal, verbal and written communication, problem solving and project management skills
• The ability to work well under pressure with multiple competing deadlines
• A flexible attitude towards a variety of work tasks as is required in a small working group
• Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt
• Driven to achieve results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinking

item.title: Analyst, Total Portfolio Management
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Under the leadership of the Chief Investment Officer, the Total Portfolio Management Group is a newly formed team, providing a holistic lens across the OMERS investment portfolio, with responsibility for asset allocation, currency, liquidity management and economic research at the total portfolio level. The Total Portfolio Management group works closely with the broader investment teams and partners to integrate best-in-class thinking across OMERS to support balance sheet growth.

As a member of the Total Portfolio Management group, the Analyst will contribute to the team’s mission of improving OMERS’ ability to meet its promises to pensioners by supporting better, more informed investment decisions on how to allocate capital across the total portfolio and by managing OMERS’ liquidity, leverage and FX profile. This candidate will gain exposure to portfolio construction, economic research, liquidity and currency management. Examples include managing liquidity and leverage to ensure resilience and flexibility, supporting cross-portfolio analysis research to improve long-term investment results, managing overall strategic currency exposures for the Total Plan and provide pertinent economic research and forward-looking analysis to support investment decisions

The right person for this role is a strong team player, demonstrates intellectual curiosity, brings outstanding communication skills and has a keen interest in financial markets.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Providing support for the oversight and optimization of total plan leverage & liquidity which includes building and maintaining relationships internally as well as with banks, rating agencies and industry professionals
  • Providing portfolio analysis and research to identify opportunities to enhance the portfolio
  • Conducting scenario analysis to support overall portfolio construction and investment strategies
  • Enhancing and supporting automation, data visualization, and analytics to improve the group’s tool set and reporting
  • Synthesizing analysis and views into clear, concise messages that can be shared with stakeholders throughout OMERS
  • Bringing new perspectives and distilling insights when analyzing our portfolio and strategies
  • Collaborating, sharing information and insights across investment teams to deliver the best outcomes for the pension plan
  • Helping to communicate strategic investment direction of the Total Plan

To succeed in this role, you bring:

  • University degree in business, economics, quantitative or related discipline
  • Chartered Financial Analyst or committed to completing the program
    • Keen interest in financial markets, portfolio construction, currency, thematic research and macro-economics
    • 1+ years of industry experience covering portfolio management/capital markets/private markets/strategy preferably at a financial institution, pension fund, insurance company, asset management firm/management consulting firm
  • Exceptional ability to communicate potentially complex ideas and results simply and effectively, to a diverse range of stakeholders
  • Intellectual curiosity, an eagerness to learn, and you are thoughtful, diligent and proactive in gathering information
  • Ability to work with large amounts of data
  • A high attention to detail that complements your ability to see the big picture
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders and to deliver cross departmental projects/solutions
  • Action-oriented and proactive with a high degree of initiative
  • Effective team player with a collaborative attitude
  • Ability to multitask and manage a steady stream of priorities
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Familiarity with Bloomberg, PowerBI preferred but not required

item.title: Manager, Global Talent Acquisition Strategy
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Reporting to the Director, Talent Acquisition, this role is responsible for consulting and collaborating with a broad range of stakeholders in support of the goals and objectives of Talent Acquisition.

Responsibilities will be in the design, development, delivery, and evaluation of global programs and services that support and build policies and processes to attract and retain top talent while promoting global consistency and alignment to strategic objectives. This role will lead the creation of global Talent Acquisition strategies and programs, with a mandate to: advance hiring practices (including assessments), design new sourcing and recruiting programs, prioritize the new-hire experience across OMERS, and strengthen and maintain a driven recruitment brand in the market with strong focus on the development of our Global Campus strategy.

Accountabilities:

Leadership

  • Lead and provide strategic and operational oversight to a team of direct reports to execute on recruitment strategies, ensuring a great candidate experience to drive higher quality candidates for the business to hire while establishing a talent pipeline for future needs

  • Act as an escalation point for Talent Acquisition and campus strategy queries, ensuring business and HR teams are aligning strategy with execution efforts

Global Campus & Strategy

  • Define global campus recruitment strategies and programs (e.g., collaborate with universities and strengthen reputation) ensuring the acquisition of strong pipeline talent into the organization; navigate the complexity of global markets and align to strategic workforce plans and our inclusion and diversity strategy

  • Create our global New Graduate programs, aligned to strategic workforce plans and our inclusion and diversity strategy; ensure best-in-class retention and exceptional new grad experiences

  • In partnership with People Analytics & Insights team, incorporate workforce data insights into program design and development, create targeted programs based on inclusion and diversity analysis, and develop strategies to monitor impact across the portfolio

Employee Value Proposition

  • Craft our global employee value proposition (EVP) and brand to showcase the value employees can expect to receive, including benefits, opportunities, and rewards

  • Develop social media engagement strategy and programs that align to our EVP and enhance our access to critical talent pools

  • Make recommendations and influence senior level stakeholders in support of building critical talent pools globally and enhancing our brand in the market

Assessments

  • Develop a global selection assessment strategy to target the right talent and capabilities, and contribute to a positive candidate experience (e.g., by leveraging artificial intelligence and gamification)

  • Evaluate the effectiveness, efficiency and new-hire experience of Talent Acquisition processes and identify required changes and updates

Vendor Management

  • Own the budget and vendor relationships for the portfolio; Source, approve, and maintain agency partnerships

Candidate Experience

  • Own the candidate experience, including onboarding, ensuring OMERS is leveraging best-in-class technologies and approaches

  • Continuously look to improve candidate, new hire, hiring manager and recruiter experience

  • Conduct industry research, keeping abreast of the latest news and trends of the recruitment world and providing analysis on the global talent market

Skills & Experience:

  • Undergraduate degree in Business, Human Resources, or a related discipline. 

  • Experience with leading a team of direct reports including coaching and mentoring

  • 8+ years of demonstrated successful experience in any combination of the following:

    • Full-cycle Talent Acquisition/campus recruitment

    • Employee value proposition/brand

    • Candidate experience, employee experience & onboarding programs/practices

    • New graduate/rotational programs

    • Social media strategy, and/or;

    • Talent assessments

  • Ability to adapt strategy and programs to a frequently changing, complex global context

  • Knowledge and experience working in a financial services organization and operating model 

  • Advanced knowledge of human capital trends and best practices 

  • Demonstrated learning agility and curiosity

  • Organization-wide program and project design, delivery and evaluation expertise 

  • Exceptional interpersonal skills to build collaborative relationships with, and influence, leaders at all levels of the organization

  • Highly skilled at coaching, facilitating, and presenting to a range of audiences 

  • Strong client-centered and service excellence approach 

  • Demonstrates strong self-awareness and self-management competencies aligned with organizational values 

  • Ability to deal effectively with competing and shifting priorities 

  • Experience with balanced scorecard performance indicators and metrics 

  • Advanced MS Office applications 

  • Proficiency in using Applicant Tracking Systems, preferably Workday

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

We are looking for a highly motivated seasoned DevOps Engineer to join our Pension Products and Technology team in Toronto. In this role, you will be responsible for recommending and configuring continuous process improvements through the implementation of automation to build source code artifacts, deployment of artifacts, monitoring, code quality scanning, and improving the quality of testing. You will also be responsible for data refreshes across environments, automation of manual tasks, monitoring of batch SQL jobs, and configuration of batch runtime improvements.

You will be part of growing a product development team to deliver new and existing products and services for OMERS Pensions. The Products & Technology team is an exciting new team focused on using the newest technologies and approaches to deliver solutions & systems for the modern-day end user. Our primary focus and commitments are to provide real value and we encourage innovation and empower open-thinking for all our team members. We’re excited for the opportunity to have highly driven and impactful talent join our team!


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Working with Kubernetes and deployment of containerized micro-service on GCP
  • Recommending automation improvements to replace manual tasks utilizing DevOps tooling
  • Maintain GCP infrastructure through code using Ansible and Terraform. 
  • Creating process benchmarks which will feed into baseline trending reports and documentation for new scripts, new configurations, patch set levels, etc.
  • Defining implementation and contingency plan for system upgrade and providing impact analysis and recommendation for system updates
  • Coordinating with all teams and end users for change requests and providing regular status and schedule updates to the team
  • Monitoring tools and system analytics to quickly diagnose the root cause of system issues
  • Developing Unix shell scripts for system level analytics
  • Creating and re-enforcing the use of checklists for routine tasks to ensure consistency of task delivery
  • Creating and maintaining currency of operational runbooks for components so known issues are not re-encountered by other team members
  • Experience in developing and maintaining documentation and wiki for multiple environments
  • Work closely with internal business partners to gather requirements, design and implement solutions, manage technical operations, triage and fix operational issues
  • Developing and implementing logging and system monitoring best practices, standards and guidelines
  • Applying vendor provided system patches to DevOps tooling and Kubernetes containers
  • Keep abreast of technology trends and developments

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • A University degree in the field of Information Technology
  • Experience with the following:
    • Workload on Google Cloud Platform
    • RHEL 7+ Linux OS and shell scripting
    • Monitoring tools for statistics analysis and pro-active system tuning such as DataDog
    • GitLab CI/CD pipeline design and scheduling with code quality stages spanning the lifecycle of Continuous Build & Quality, Continuous Deploy, and Continuous Testing
    • Knowledge of security best practices including authentication protocols, ACL rules, and Identity Management mechanisms
    • understanding of Networking principles and protocols such as IP subnetting, routing, firewall rules, Virtual Private Cloud, LoadBalancer, Cloud DNS, Cloud CDN, etc
    • Release management and branching techniques
  • High enthusiasm with a sense of urgency to get things done
  • Self-starter with the ability to work in a cross functional team-based environment
  • Possesses excellent analytical and problem resolution skills
  • Ability and willingness to teach skills and share experiences with other team members
  • Positive attitude and a strong commitment to delivering quality work

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Analyst, Investment Finance
item.description:

We are looking for an Analyst, Investment Finance to join our team!

The successful candidate will be a vital resource to the OMERS Infrastructure team and will be responsible for the accounting and reporting functions, as well as providing transaction support and analytics for the assigned portfolio of assets. The successful candidate must demonstrate the ability to learn new tools and processes, as well as handle multiple tasks, often working within tight deadlines. This is an excellent opportunity to enhance basic professional skills, strengthen business acumen, develop an understanding of investment reporting, portfolio analytics as well as exposure to the infrastructure investing environment.

The Analyst, Investment Finance will have various duties including:

  • Prepares journal entries and account reconciliations as part of the financial reporting process with appropriate analysis and supporting documentation;

  • Prepares monthly and year-end working papers with appropriate analysis and supporting documentation for annual financial reporting and audit purposes;

  • Assists with cash forecasting and accounts payable activities;

  • Prepares funding requests and wire instructions for transfers of cash between bank accounts on a timely basis;

  • Prepares schedules and reports requested by Investment Operations and Corporate Financial Reporting;

  • Prepares variance analysis on financial data;

  • Prepares regulatory reports including reports to Statistics Canada, U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis, and CRA;

  • Assists in accounting research and finance issues as assigned and provides summary reports;

  • Assists with the development and implementation of budgets and forecasts;

  • Prepares quarterly/annual financial statements, with covenant ratio calculations as required

  • Assists with tax filings when required; and

  • Participates in special projects or duties, as required

QUALIFICATIONS

  • University degree in Business or related discipline;

  • Completion or enrolment in Chartered Professional Accountant designation;

  • Knowledge of IFRS and pension accounting is preferred;

  • Investment Accounting experience is an asset;

  • Highly proficient in Microsoft Office tools especially Excel (intermediate to advanced level);

  • Excellent analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills;

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; and

  • A strong team player able to operate in a fast-paced environment with numerous priorities and deadlines with effective organization time management skills.

item.title: Application Developer (Python)
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

About Risk Technology:
Integrated with the Fund Investment Risk Management group, the Risk Technology team creates products that enables OMERS to make investment decisions rapidly and confidently. We work in tandem with clients across risk, capital markets and private markets to develop tailor made applications aligned to their decision-making needs. We also serve as translators across investments, technology and operations functions, instilling data governance and technology best practices across the organization.

About the Role:

You will be the lead application developer (full stack) on FIRM’s model management platform. As part of a revamp of OMERS Risk Infrastructure, the model management platform will be a critical application that documents and monitors the performance of the thousands of mathematical models employed in Risk’s quantitative analytics process. In this role, you will be working closely with the VP of Risk Technology and involved in a full application development cycle: from user journeys to go-live.
 

Responsibilities:

  • Working with users in risk, capital markets and operations teams; leading the documentation of user journeys and identifying application features.

  • Supporting the design and development of the application architecture – helping make key decisions on (but not limited to) the tech stack and data models.

  • As a backend developer (support), taking on development tasks including: the creation of models, views, business logic, test cases and API documentation.

  • As a frontend developer (lead), leading the development of visual components and client-side logic.

  • Developing scripts to consume and produce XML files to interface with the OMERS risk system.

  • Developers are expected to write succinct, efficient code that is easy to read and maintain.

  • Communicating requirements with partners in IT to deploy cloud infrastructure to house the application.

  • Developing deployment configurations (Docker, Kubernetes) to automate app deployment.

Qualifications  & Skills:

  • Demonstrated capability in full stack application development which can include:

    • A university or professional degree in computer science, programming, engineering or similarly quantitative discipline.

    • 4+ years experience developing client facing applications including both backend and frontend work.

  • Backend stack: Django, Django REST Framework, Postgres

  • Frontend stack: One of: Angular 2, Vue or React

  • Other tools/platforms: Docker, Linux VMs, Git.

  • ETL experience, working with XML files in Python

  • Basic knowledge of investments and financial instruments, including fixed income and derivatives. An understanding of their terms and conditions is a strong plus.

  • Experience working with investment, risk or trading datasets.

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

item.title: Account Executive
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

At Canvass Analytics, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered analytics platform transforms plant operations, giving them predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering Fortune 1,500 industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. Canvass Analytics’ customers include leading energy, manufacturing, food and ag, oil and gas, and metals and mining companies around the globe.

We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

Who We Need

Canvass Analytics is seeking an Account Executive to join our sales team, a true hunter who wants to join us in North America at this pivotal point in our growth. You will develop your territory, build out the sales strategy and satisfy your drive to close the deal. You are a pioneer in an industry calling out for disruption, transforming the way operational decisions in the Industrial sector are made using AI.

Who You Are

You are ready to take the next step in your career, understand the Industrial market and come with a roster of contacts who you are prepared to call. You have a proven track record of building relationships, from C-suite to Operations Managers. Empowering prospects and clients with data-driven insights to help them save money, accelerate competitive advantage and stay ahead is what motivates you. You are happiest on the road pursuing your targets and gaining new ground in this race to become an industry leader in industrial AI.

What You Bring
  • You have an Engineering degree and the logical, technical approach that comes with it.
  • Industry experience. You have 5 years selling into industrial companies, perhaps working for larger companies and moving into progressively more nimble ones. You get an adrenaline rush every time you close the deal. Your achievements go beyond quotas, extending into highly satisfied clients who trust your expertise.
  • Motivation and drive. You get a thrill from pursuing the close which also means you are calm under pressure and can make sound decisions quickly. The confidence in our product and our company just makes it easier for you.
  • Sales methodology and innovation. You believe in following a process because it works and changing it up when it doesn’t. You want to contribute to building tactics and refining our processes for repeatable success.
  • Communication. You have outstanding presentation skills. Your consulting approach in meetings gains the trust of those listening to you. Your written and verbal one-on-one communication skills - including the ability to listen and provide a real solution to a client’s unique issues - are why you consistently exceed quota.
  • Passion. You want to be in sales - this is where your career path starts and ends. You are genuinely interested in new ideas and new technology.
Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches
Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for theIndustrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange asa Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’sGradient Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in.  From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

Apply Now

Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all?If you feel you meet 70% of the qualifications listed and you are an innovative team player, express your interest here and we promise to consider your full profile.

You can also follow us on Twitter or LinkedIn to learn more about us.

Canvass Analytics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

Things you should know about our tech:
  • ‍We use a microservices architecture built predominantly with Python
  • Our single-page web application is built with React and we use Django for our RESTful API layer
  • We use Kubernetes to manage our cloud deployments in Azure
  • We’ve built a data pipeline with Kafka and use Kubeflow to orchestrate our machine learning pipeline
  • We use CircleCI to continuously integrate and deploy code changes

‍What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • Experience building web applications with Python, bonus points for experience with a RESTful API framework
  • Experience using React (or other JavaScript frameworks) to build complex web applications
  • An understanding of microservice architecture and distributed system design
  • Proven track record of delivering well-designed and tested software
  • Solid understanding of relational and non-relational databases and best practices

In general, we’re looking for a senior developer that exemplify these qualities:

Activation & Engagement Our developers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our developers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.

‍Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. Developers work very closely with a small number of other developers, a designer, and a product manager to meaningfully impact the business every week.

‍Excellence & Craft Software development is more than checking features off a list of requirements. We need our developers to build systems that are accessible to new teammates and extensible so that they can evolve with our business. We want our developers to take pride in what they build.

‍Communication & Leadership A developer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates. We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and build your career as the company grows.  

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • An incredible team with Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • You build the future of the planet. An opportunity to work in a leading edge AI company that is making the planet safer and greener for the future.  
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with option to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Equity Plan
What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We have an inclusive culture and we are driven by the passion to make an impact to the future of the industrial sector which in turn impacts the climate sustainability.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

At Canvass Analytics, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered analytics platform transforms plant operations, giving them predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering Fortune 1,500 industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. Things you should know about our product & teams
  • We don’t build machine learning pipelines to solve specific problems: we create pipelines that are able to solve classes of industrial data problems
  • We use Keras, SciKit-Learn,XGBoost, SHAP and regularly research and add new libraries to our stack
  • Our pipelines and micro services are developed predominantly with Python
  • We use Kubeflow to build flexible ML pipelines and Kafka for data pipelines
  • We use CircleCI to continuously test, integrate and deploy code changes, including ML
What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • Experience applying machine learning and deep learning algorithms to time-series problems
  • Strong knowledge of probability and statistics, plus a passion for working with data
  • The ability to implement feature engineering and data transformations at scale
  • Solid Python development skills, including experience with NumPy, Pandas and one or more ML libraries
  • An understanding of micro service architecture and containerization
  • A proven track record of delivering well-designed and tested software

In general, we’re looking for engineers that exemplify these qualities:

  • Communication & Leadership An engineer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates.We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.
Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches
Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for theIndustrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange asa Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’sGradient Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes. We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We have an inclusive culture.

‍Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

‍

item.title: Product Marketing - Industry Lead
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

​Job Description

Reporting to the VP of Marketing, you live and breathe product marketing and know the immense value this strategic function brings to an organization. Through your proven experience in B2B -SaaS product marketing, you have learned how to keep your eye on the big picture and execute on what needs to get done to move the needle.

We are looking for an experienced, collaborative, and driven Product Marketing Industry Lead, who will take Canvass AI to new heights and drive rapid growth across existing and new markets. You will be responsible for core go-to-market activism and ongoing product success - defining product positioning through a deep understanding of the market, buyers, and key competitors. You will synthesize information and serve as an internal and external evangelist and influencer to ensure the sales, marketing, and customer success are equipped with the right tools, knowledge, and information to properly position Canvass AI to win in the market.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, build and analyze various marketing plans, strategies and campaigns to power the growth of Canvass AI’s brand and product.
  • Develop and launch campaigns to support our GTM (go to market) initiatives.
  • Develop targeted and meaningful content, product positioning and messaging that differentiates Canvass AI capabilities across the industry.
  • Communicate the value proposition of Canvass AI’s platform and capabilities to sales enablement and develop assets and sales tools that support the sales cycle.
  • Participate in the launch of new product releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of industry-agnostic plans.
  • Work closely with our Product Management and Go-To-Market teams to develop enablement content, product demos, sales tools and strategies.
  • Help drive market intelligence through in-depth industry and competitive analysis, while consistently devising programs to outpace the competition.
  • Develop the strategy and manage the marketing programs that drive demand within the industry.
  • Work with our broader marketing team to develop thought leadership and increase awareness of Canvass AI for expert data scientist user personas, influencers, and decision makers.
  • Create and maintain a crystal clear and highly compelling product messaging matrix.
  • Create and shape customer personas.
  • Track competitive marketing landscape against category.
  • Empower sales with competitive intelligence, and create and maintain competitor talking tracks, battle cards, cheat sheets, FAQs, and training.

Qualifications

  • SaaS product marketing experience is a must.
  • 8-10 years of work experience in B2B Product Marketing and/or Product Management.
  • Deep understanding of machine learning and analytic applications, especially in production / operational environments.
  • Demonstrated success in product launches and end-to-end execution of supporting marketing strategies.
  • Excellent communication skills a must; written and oral, including presentation and product demonstration experience to large and diverse audiences. You have a knack for developing compelling, differentiated, and memorable product narratives.
  • Analyst relations experience with firms such as Forrester and Gartner.
  • You enjoy collaborating with passionate cross-functional teams (e.g., sales, product management, marketing, customer success).
  • Roll up your sleeve get stuff done attitude with high growth start-up experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field.

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches

Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’s Gradient Ventures.

​What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in.  From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture

item.title: Cloud Data Developer, Professional Services, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-02-18T21:31:57.347Z

Cloud Data Developer, Professional Services, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Toronto, ON, Canada; Vancouver, BC, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with data processing software (Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive) and algorithms (MapReduce, Flume).
  • Experience writing software in one/more languages: Java, C++, Python, Go, JavaScript.
  • Experience managing client-facing projects, troubleshooting clients\' technical issues, working with engineering, sales, services, and customers.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working data warehouses, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ELT and reporting/analytic tools and environments.
  • Experience in technical consulting.
  • Experience working with big data, information retrieval, data mining or machine learning as well as experience in building multi-tier high availability applications with modern web technologies (e.g., NoSQL, MongoDB, SparkML, Tensorflow).
  • Experience architecting, developing software, or internet scale production-grade Big Data solutions in virtualized environments.

About the job

The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You listen to the customer and swiftly problem-solve technical issues to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Cloud business and helping companies around the world innovate.

As a Cloud Data Developer, you\'ll guide customers on how to ingest, store, process, analyze, and explore/visualize data on the Google Cloud Platform. You will work on data migrations and transformational projects, and with customers to design large-scale data processing systems, develop data pipelines optimized for scaling, and troubleshoot potential platform challenges.

In this role you are the Google Developer working with Google\'s most strategic Google Cloud customers. Together with the team you will support customer implementation of Google Cloud products through: architecture guidance, best practices, data migration, capacity planning, implementation, troubleshooting, monitoring, and much more.

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Act as a trusted technical advisor to customers and solve complex Big Data challenges.
  • Create and deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles, sample code and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.
  • Travel up to 30% of the time as required.
  • Communicate effectively via video conferencing for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities.

Locations

item.title: Data Analytics Sales Specialist, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-01-31T23:31:27.113Z

Data Analytics Sales Specialist, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • 7 years of experience promoting analytics, data warehousing, or data management software
  • Experience planning, pitching, and executing a territory sales strategy
  • Experience executing commercial and legal agreements with procurement, legal, and business teams
  • Experience working with sales developers and customer technical leads to build business cases for transformation and accompanying plans for implementation

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with market-leading Business Intelligence (BI) front-end, data analytics middleware, or back-end data warehouse technologies
  • Experience with Google Cloud Data and Analytics offerings (e.g., BigQuery, Looker, Dataproc, Publisher/Subscriber (Pub/Sub), etc.)
  • Experience using data to inform decisions and influence stakeholders
  • Experience engaging and influencing executive stakeholders as a business advisor and leader in data and analytics
  • Understanding of data analytics technology (e.g., Hadoop/Spark, data warehouses, data streaming, ETL and data governance, predictive analytics, etc.)
  • Excellent business acumen and analytics skills

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are made for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

At Google Cloud, we’re committed to offering customers a Data and Analytics (DA) platform to build excellent solutions and deliver business transformation built on trusted insights and automation.

As a Data Analytics Sales Specialist, you will build an understanding of our customers\' businesses and help them deliver their strategies. You will promote data analytics and work with account teams, customer development, and partners to ensure customer outcomes.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Manage numbers and calibrate the business against objectives and key results and accurately forecasting/reporting the state of the business.
  • Build and maintain executive relationships with customers and influence long-term strategic direction.
  • Develop and execute strategic account plans, including a broader enterprise plan across key industries.
  • Assist customers in identifying use cases suitable for Google Cloud Data and Analytics solutions and articulate key solution differentiators and measurable business impacts.
  • Partner with account and technical teams to develop/drive pipeline, and develop Go-To-Market (GTM) efforts with Google Cloud Platform partners.

Location

item.title: Marketing Analyst, Android Consumer Marketing
item.description:
2022-01-27T20:01:37.314Z

Marketing Analyst, Android Consumer Marketing

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in media analytics, advertising sales, digital media and marketing, consulting, or financial analysis.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data, or with other programming or scripting languages (e.g., R, Python, C++, etc.).
  • Experience working with databases and dashboards using all relevant data to inform decisions.
  • Experience leading cross-functional work with Product Management and Engineering partners.
  • Experience and ability working in complex, ambiguous, fast-paced environments.

About the job

You will drive measurement, analysis, and testing initiatives supporting global and regional marketing programs. You will directly analyze large data sets, and design and perform statistical analyses that continuously improve our process efficiency and campaign impact. In collaboration with a multidisciplinary team of marketing, product management, analytics and engineers, you will tap into the underlying data, align on key metrics/methodologies and generate insights that enable marketers to develop valuable, highly effective programs.

In this role, you will work with our global product, finance, and sales teams, Android Product Marketing supports every facet of the Android business. You will work with product development and go-to-market (GTM) teams.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google\'s products solve the world\'s problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

Responsibilities

  • Identify key growth and sustainability opportunities for Android Consumer Marketing across various points of the customer lifecycle. Understand business challenges, transform problems into data-driven frameworks, and communicate complex findings in a structured and clear manner to a non-technical audiences.
  • Design experiments, develop statistical models, and use causal inference tools to measure and improve marketing effectiveness.
  • Make business recommendations via presentations that effectively translate technical work to business partners and executives through synthesized findings and visual storytelling.
  • Engage in ad-hoc analysis to understand business performance/user metrics and provide concise summaries and recommendations to management.
  • Develop and shape the marketing analytics function and help to source and transform data into scalable dashboards and tools.

Location

item.title: Analytical Lead, Government, Entertainment, and Technology
item.description:
2022-02-11T03:01:52.421Z

Analytical Lead, Government, Entertainment, and Technology

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of experience in a client-facing analytics role including strategy consulting, analytics, statistical analysis, or data science
  • Experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data, or with other programming or scripting languages such as R, Python, and/or C++

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with digital marketing and web analytics platforms, including app analytics
  • Experience working cross-functionally and building relationships with external clients and internal teams
  • Ability to analyze large data sets and translate them to actionable insights

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

The Measurement and Insights team focuses on ensuring our clients and partners understand the impact their investment with Google has on their business and leverages the tools available to drive better results. We deliver this in the context of a changing privacy landscape, providing recommendations, thought leadership, analyses, and technical integrations.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Build and own client relationships with media and analytics stakeholders to influence investment and measurement decisions based on risks and impact to their business, and lead client-specific measurement plans that define roadmap to improve client’s measurement and attribution maturity based on client’s measurement and attribution gaps
  • Advise clients on experiments to demonstrate the impact of Google media and design analyses that uncover growth opportunities using products, market data, and platforms to improve media performance
  • Build ways to solve client business needs and share best practices (e.g., analysis, tools, frameworks, etc.) and client successes across industries
  • Drive adoption of measurement and attribution solutions to better value Google and non-Google media, increase measurement maturity, and quantify business impact of media recommendation based on client business objectives, and craft recommendations to lead to client action

  • Experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data, or with other programming or scripting languages such as R, Python, and/or C++

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with digital marketing and web analytics platforms, including app analytics
  • Experience working cross-functionally and building relationships with external clients and internal teams
  • Ability to analyze large data sets and translate them to actionable insights

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

The Measurement and Insights team focuses on ensuring our clients and partners understand the impact their investment with Google has on their business and leverages the tools available to drive better results. We deliver this in the context of a changing privacy landscape, providing recommendations, thought leadership, analyses, and technical integrations.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Build and own client relationships with media and analytics stakeholders to influence investment and measurement decisions based on risks and impact to their business, and lead client-specific measurement plans that define roadmap to improve client’s measurement and attribution maturity based on client’s measurement and attribution gaps
  • Advise clients on experiments to demonstrate the impact of Google media and design analyses that uncover growth opportunities using products, market data, and platforms to improve media performance
  • Build ways to solve client business needs and share best practices (e.g., analysis, tools, frameworks, etc.) and client successes across industries
  • Drive adoption of measurement and attribution solutions to better value Google and non-Google media, increase measurement maturity, and quantify business impact of media recommendation based on client business objectives, and craft recommendations to lead to client action

Location

item.title: Measurement Lead, Omnichannel
item.description:
2022-02-02T04:01:39.088Z

Measurement Lead, Omnichannel

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role and/or equivalent professional experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with articulating analytical questions, pulling data from data sets, and using data to arrive at an answer and recommendation with experience in Omnichannel.
  • Experience working cross-functionally and managing a set of executive cross-functional stakeholders, and/or business partner experience.
  • Experience with any of the following: Search, Display, YouTube, Direct Response Digital Advertising, Attribution, Conversion Tracking, Automated Bidding, and Platforms.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with ability to tailor messages to different internal and external audiences.
  • Comfort with using quantitative tools to develop advertiser segments, and create lead lists and track operational metrics.

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As the Measurement Lead focused on Omnichannel, you will be responsible for helping clients navigate the Online to Offline landscape, including guiding them through how to best utilize Google\'s Omnichannel solutions to accurately measure their media and optimize towards an omni goal.

You will help our internal Sales teams identify and implement the right Omnichannel measurement solution for our clients, be the subject-matter expert (SME) for all things related to measuring Omnichannel conversions and actions, helping our internal Sales teams identify and implement the right Omnichannel solutions for our clients.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze internal and external data to identify opportunities, anticipate risks, develop solutions to customer marketing challenges, and measure success.
  • Develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders and earn their trust to challenge the status quo together by telling stories with data, both visually and verbally.
  • Collaborate across teams to innovate, activating full measurement and attribution product capabilities for customers, and develop scalable solutions to industry challenges focused on first-party conversions solutions.
  • Advise on marketing analytics, including tagging, attribution, lifetime value, customer segmentation, and data integration.
  • Lead the full lifecycle of measurement initiatives, from idea to implementation.

Location
