item.title: Manager - Planning & Engineering (Wireless Radio Network Capacity)
item.description:
Description

Make strategic decisions that will shape the future

 

Join our team

 

The RAN Capacity team is a group of highly motivated engineers and data scientists who have a passion for delivering the network capacity needed to support our customers increasing demand for wireless service. Our team is responsible for the capacity planning and engineering of TELUS’ award winning wireless networks. This includes a broad range of planning and engineering activities, from projects that guide executive strategy to implementing network augments that support customer traffic at special events (e.g. New Year’s Eve celebrations).

This is an opportunity to join a highly visible, dynamic team during a transformational journey. With the increasing complexity of radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology you will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning, but also shape the future of our 5G networks to deliver continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As the leader of the wireless capacity team, you’ll provide technical and people leadership to ensure we efficiently deploy network capacity to meet the increasing demand for wireless service. You will leverage your deep technical knowledge of AI and Machine learning in conjunction with your entrepreneurial spirit to take calculated risks and drive the continued transformation of the wireless capacity team through the use of automation and data science.

Your ability to lead, your competitive spirit, your passion for innovation, and your strong RF engineering background all coupled with your keen knowledge and experience leveraging AI and ML will allow us to find the best ways of shaping our wireless network not just to support existing mobility services but to cater to the next generation of use cases that 5G brings. Finally, together as a team, we will help shape the future vision of TELUS’ wireless network by providing important guidance to executives on how to best address our evolving business challenges. You and your team’s efforts will ensure that our millions of customers are able to enjoy a world class wireless network experience.

Description

Here\'s how

 

•    Provide leadership and support to the wireless capacity team so they can continue to build on their data analytics and software development capabilities
•    Ensure strong team engagement and enhance a sense of close connection regardless of geography
•    Facilitate ongoing learning and development in the latest wireless network technologies and best practices
•    Provide ongoing informal and formal coaching and face to face meetings
•    Collaborate with the planning and implementation teams to ensure that the produced capacity plans get deployed at the right time in the network
•    Act as an ambassador and point of contact for TELUS wireless service(s) and confidently present findings and presentations to senior leadership
•    Cultivate strong, collaborative partnerships with other leaders, including Strategy and Product Development teams to understand new technologies and services to prepare your team for success in an evolving and competitive business environment
•    Challenge, inspire, and motivate team members towards continued improvements, skills development and technical innovations by leveraging machine learning techniques, you will identify capacity issues in the network
•    Continue to push the status quo – integrate, implement and improve on current network tools/technologies
•    Identify new solutions to capacity issues with data science methodologies including big data analysis, to improve the efficiency of TELUS’ capacity plan
•    Lead your team in developing new dashboards and data visualizations with the goal of providing insight(s) into network capacity which will then be shared with executives and peer groups

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Known as an inspiring leader who coaches and develops team members, cultivating a highly engaged and high performance team
•    Noted for your expertise in 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    Strong knowledge of AI and ML, demonstrated use of leveraging big data for driving decisions
•    Regarded as an exceptional communicator, influencer and negotiator, able to build and maintain strong partnerships with internal and external stakeholders
•    Recognized as having strong business and financial acumen who drives innovation, change and process improvements
•    Experienced with Agile and DevOps software development practices
•    Respected for your track record of operational execution and delivery excellence and achieving results in a complex environment
•    Noted for your strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and poise when faced with difficult challenges
•    Sought out for your knowledge in network capacity dimensioning (wireline or wireless)
•    Mastery in being able to craft stories that turn complex ideas into simple concepts
•    Respected for your courage to take risks, lead innovation and explore unchartered territory within the technology and telecommunications space
•    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    MBA or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
•    Experience with swarm intelligence and/or generative artificial intelligence
•    Experience deploying NodeJS app, microservices, cloud application deployment or distributed systems
•    You possess a strong understanding of databases and big data, including: MySQL, NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, Splunk) 
•    Prior experience with at least one or two programming languages: JavaScript, Python, R, Go, C#

item.title: Design Specialist II - RAN Performance & Optimization
item.description:
Description

Join our team

 

There’s a lot of buzz around the next leaps in wireless network optimization, leveraging data science, big data and machine learning. Join a team that is re-thinking how we optimize our wireless network by blending wireless engineering, computational analysis, and programming. At TELUS, with over 9 million subscribers, there’s a lot of data being generated from our network, and with this lies untapped potential for data mining and advanced insights towards improving our customers’ wireless experience. 

As a member of Eastern Canada\'s wireless network performance team, you\'ll be responsible for optimizing the Radio Access Network (RAN), and finding new angles/methods to improve network performance, efficiently. You\'ll join the larger Wireless Networks & Services DevOps team that is providing TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience in every region of the country.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

In our team, you\'ll ensure our customers\' wireless experience continuously improves. Your "think outside of the box" and innovation will help shape our Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that we use to govern our customers\' wireless experience. Also, your data science and automation mindset will provide inputs to our tools team to improve the quality and efficiency of the way we do network performance engineering.
 

Description

Here’s how

 

•    You\'ll be responsible for the network performance of a region in Eastern Canada
•    You’ll ensure network performance KPIs are meeting our targets, and are continuously improving
•    You’ll troubleshoot network degradations, determine root causes, and look for ways to prevent or reduce the impact to our customers
•    You’ll support network upgrades by analyzing the impacts on performance, and proposing optimizations to enrich the overall customer experience
•    You’ll aid our client support teams for escalated issues that may require network engineering to resolve
•    You’ll be exposed to the latest wireless technology innovation planned for TELUS, and be ready to support their launch from a performance management perspective

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Bachelor degree in Engineering
•    3+ years of relevant professional experience
•    Excellent knowledge of LTE radio access network optimization and performance engineering: parameter optimization, layer 3 messaging, mobility management and traffic balancing
•    RAN equipment knowledge: parameters, capabilities and limitations of the hardware and software portfolio
•    Good wireless core network knowledge (VoLTE, EPC, IMS) and 5G technology
•    Proficient with ActixOne and Netscout
•    Familiar with SPLUNK, SQL, Python (or other scripting languages)

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Masters of Engineering
•    Samsung/Huawei RAN equipment knowledge
•    Advanced programming skills for automation and big data manipulation (Hadoop, SPLUNK, Python, SQL, Tableau)
•    Machine learning experience or certifications

item.title: Data Scientist/Engineer
item.description:
Join our team

 

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an organization?  Do you love technology, love to learn and have a global mindset?  Are you passionate about collaborating with fellow data professionals to drive positive outcomes for customers?  If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard the TELUS Partner Solutions, Predictive Analytics & Customer Excellence (PACE) team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of our analytics capabilities. 

 

As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we deliver next generation networks like 5G; unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything; and deliver an incredible customer experience. In TELUS Partner Solutions, we work with telecom carriers, value added resellers, managed service providers and software based platform providers from around the world! Our mandate is to ensure that TELUS Partner Solutions is at the forefront of innovative software-based platform industry developments that will drive growth for TELUS domestically and internationally. You could be a big part of our success in 2021 and beyond!

 

In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.
 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


As a Data Scientist / Engineer you’ll play a key role in designing innovative data solutions and solving challenging problems, to drive continuous business improvement, and achieve best in class customer experience.  The possibilities are endless – at any given time, you could be collaborating to build a data warehouse from scratch, writing beautiful code, working with our internal partner teams to provide sound data sets, or developing AI/ML models to support feature enhancements for new products. It’s why we’re looking for a data superstar who is filled with ideas as well as the delivery-focused mindset to execute them! There will be tons of learning opportunities along the way, not to mention the ability to work with some of the best leaders and mentors in the industry.  All you have to do is bring your passion, great attitude, and grit. Are you ready for the challenge?
 

Here\'s how

 

  • You will provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments
  • You will expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience
  • You will act as a trusted advisor and partner, and collaborate across various business units to accelerate the transformation of our platforms, improve the customer and team member experience, and drive business efficiencies.
  • You will lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • You will collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • You will work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • You will Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • You will influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset
  • You will develop reusable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • You will support and evolve our Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • You will build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Support a number of business critical operational activities
  • Continue to enhance our Business, Customer and Market Intelligence and drive actionable insights for our sales, marketing and care teams
  • Mentor, coach and provide expert guidance to team members

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, demand forecasting and optimization and bring 3 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences with the ability to influence others in presenting ideas and concepts.
  • You have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good cross-functional working relationships with peers, and internal/external business partners at multiple organizational levels
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile, outcome oriented and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast
  • You have strong business and financial acumen combined with an innovative and process improvement mindset
  • You are known as a continuous learner with a passion for technology and data
  • You are composed and poised in complex, ambiguous situations
  • You are a team player that’s creative, entrepreneurial, and willing to experiment

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • A minimum of 3 years of related predictive modeling/statistical experience
  • University degree and/or equivalent combination of experience and education
  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science would be an asset
  • Experience working in the Telecom or any related industries would be considered an asset
  • Data environments experience: MS SQL, Oracle, Postgres
  • Use of data wrangling and visualization tools such as Dataflux, Data Studio, Apache-Beam, Tableau considered strong assets
  • Familiarity with data mining, data pipelines, and deep learning platforms such as Elasticsearch, Pytorch, BigQuery, Tensorflow, Sklearn etc will be an added advantage.
  • Excellent working knowledge of GSuite Applications (GDocs, GSheet, GDrive, GSite, GSlides)
  • Familiarity or certifications with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows ( ce.g. JIRA)

item.title: Senior Digital Insights Consultant, B2B - TELUS Digital
item.description:
Description

 

Create awesome experiences for our customers.

 

Join our team

 

We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most.

 

TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, TELUS.com/business and the My TELUS app.

 

Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts.

 

Our team members are leaders in local and global technology communities, we value and support communities such as: Tech Masters, NodeSchool, Ladies Learning Code, Women Who Code TO and many more!

 

Learn more about our team at telus.com/digital

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

TELUS Digital is looking for a Senior Digital Insights Consultant to play a key role in unlocking and driving outcomes for the B2B team. You will play a key role in crafting the foundation for analytics and drive key insights that will enable our team to deliver on our Customer-First Promise.

 

We are looking for a data-driven individual who possesses strong analytical skills to help assess the efficiency of our practices, programs and processes. You will also draw on your imagination and your analytics acumen to analyze data, draw conclusions and present results. Your creativity will be key in evaluating current metrics, identifying critical metrics and leading indicators. Candidates for the role will be passionately curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and passionate about the opportunity to make more informed, objective decisions for our team.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Understand team outcomes and processes to drive data decision-making within our team
  • Evaluate and identify critical metrics and leading indicators to drive feature adoption and clean and consolidate data as required
  • Design, implement and report on Operations scorecards
  • Perform omni-channel analyses, working closely with other teams and departments and understanding their respective data
  • Use technology and analytics tools to develop models and analyze our data
  • Use data to tell the story of our operations and find opportunities to improve our practices and enhance our decision-making processes
  • Understand and translate problems and needs into recommendations and actionable tasks for the team
  • Apply data science/machine learning techniques to address real-world problems
  • Map out business customer journeys across omni-channel touchpoints to identify gaps and opportunities in order to influence customer behaviour
  • Measure the efficiency of our existing programs through analysis of available data which will include identifying issues, forming hypotheses and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations
  • Develop creative ways to gather new data and analyze results
  • Connect the dots to understand the “why” behind the data
  • Actively seek opportunities to constantly improve our processes and perform scenario based testing to support your recommendations

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • A passion for how data can be used to uncover new insights, solve unique problems and drive effective actions
  • Be a strategic thinker and a bias for action and crafting and driving change
  • Be a master of numbers, statistics and data management
  • Be curious and creative in looking at metrics to identify and testing new critical metrics for the team
  • Have strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data and master visualizations
  • Have the ability to influence and persuade team members and leadership team
  • Have strong financial skills and business insight to be able to articulate the business case & manage budgets
  • A strategic mind and a desire to get things without being scared of the details
  • A flexible approach and the ability to adapt and champion change
  • Highly organized with a demonstrated ability to monitor and manage high volume workloads and competing priorities 
  • Experience with digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics is a must
  • Experience with SQL and relational databases is a must
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience working with GitHub
  • Experience with Big data related tools and technologies, such as BigQuery
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Domo

 

About TELUS Digital:

 

We want to work with people who:

 

  • Share our passion for all things digital
  • Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment
  • Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
  • Are curious, experiment and never stop learning
  • View collaboration as essential to your work
  • Utilize the power of data to inform decisions
  • Embrace diversity and new ideas

 

What you can expect from us:

 

  • An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas 
  • Flexible work hours in a central downtown location 
  • A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code 
  • A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities
  • Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks
  • A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing

 

Accessibility

 

At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

 

Bonus points

 

Check out http://telus.com/digital/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

item.title: Senior Product Manager - TELUS Partner Hub COE - Affiliate & Ventures
item.description:
Description

#LI-Remote

The TELUS Business Solutions - Emerging Product Team is looking for a talented, driven, passionate individual with strong analytical, interpersonal, and collaboration skills. The ideal candidate will be inquisitive, curious and not afraid to try different approaches to solve a problem. Most critical will be the ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders across various marketing, finance, sales and operations. 


 
Your focus will be developing and overseeing enabling, scaling and evolving strategic partnerships in context of TELUS affiliates (M&A candidates or those that are acquired) and TELUS Ventures-back strategic partners in the space. The work here is aligned to business mandate of TBS Industry Solutions portfolio (next generation solutions anchored on 5G/IoT and data) and will work very closely with the internal and partner teams executing on the strategy to ensure a compelling benefits realization approach. The ideal candidate should have proven experience in technology and services industry with a focus on partner tactics, ecosystem enablement, and co-innovation models. 

 

What you’ll do in this role:

 

  • Role will be reporting directly to the Director of Emerging Tech Product due to the TELUS first/TELUS Business Solutions first framework impact of the assignment, role and outcome. 
  • Overall end-to-end enablement ownership of strategic partners (affiliate and ventures) with strong emphasis on managed services discipline and emerging technologies (anchored on 5G/IoT/Data and other new technology derivatives: business platforms, Industry 4.0 capabilities and others).
  • Manage planning, delivery and post-acquisition, post venture strategy development for targets of interest. 
  • Develop strategic, operational, financial and value stream enablement plans with program team and greater stakeholder group.
  • Develop competitive differentiation and benchmarking against TELUS\' competitors, as well as revenue acquisition, retention and amplification strategies. 
  • Develop forecasting revenues and units by product and customer segments aligned to target PLT owners. 
  • Develop, support execution of product/technology/services and operational roadmap for TELUS Partner Hub evolution
  • Develop, support execution of new product service introduction objectives 
  • Provide/lead internal & external processes innovation strategies to drive and improve customer experience for the TELUS Business Solutions
  • Provide product expertise to as well as lead national, cross-functional value chain team
  • Support development and implementation of industry-leading product & pricing strategies to maximize profit growth and retention
  • Support first year enablement of revenue and performance KPI before full on post-acquisition integration of before next round of TELUS Ventures funding
  • Optimize product profitability by establishing competitive price structures that capture value in the market, and meeting product and process rationalization and optimization targets
  • Manage the performance of Service Delivery for the Portfolio
  • Design scaling and transition strategy for affiliate and ventures pipeline for the greater TBS and TELUS organization.

 

       

      What you bring:

       

      • Experience in technology and services market research, focused on Partnership opportunity identification and Partner funnel development 
      • Experience building an ecosystem of strategic partners in support of new market development aligned to network effect (multi-sided networks).
      • Knowledge on sourcing and contracting partner, team agreements, contracting models and review process
      • Knowledge of contract strategy, pricing 101 and next generation multi-contract enablement
      • Service Integration & Management and integrated digital platforms and services strategy.
      • Affiliate management, ventures management from a concept and execution level. 
      • Technical background, possessing the ability to understand new market needs and identifying sound technology solutions / Partners that satisfy new market needs
      • Competitive understanding of core telco, 5G/IoT/data, value add services and next generation SaaS/ISV solutions
      • ISV ecosystem offerings in a sell to, sell with, sell through motion, and in context of co-innovation.
      • Project Management, Lean Methodology, Six Sigma and Process Efficiency Operationalization
      • Wireless / fixed broadband, Telecom and non-Telecom IT applications, systems, platforms and services
      • Engineering, IT or related technical degree with MBA preferred, or MBA with strong technical background and demonstrated experience/competence working with IP, wireless and related technologies, or 5+ years business background in a technology industry with relevant experience in a product management or development role.
      • Marketing, Business, Technical or Management certifications and/or professional designation (PMP, CSM, CPM, etc), will be an asset


       

      You’re the missing piece of the puzzle with:

       

      • Analytical and financial acumen skills; business analysis, analytics and process engineering
      • Knowledge of marketing principles and the relationships between pricing, share, value propositions, and demand drivers 
      • Superior research and presentation skills with the ability to present strategic options in a clear concise manner
      • Entrepreneurial spirit which will drive passionate ownership, process improvement and accountability for the product/portfolio 
      • Strong consulting, solution development competencies in various technologies, services and industries. Emphasis on 3rd wave and Industry 4.0 solutions.  
      • Business and enterprise architecture and design
      • Entrepreneurial mindset in the creation of solutions and translation to market products and services (business outcome/market sensitive)
      • Strong background on innovation and incubation tactics
      • Background in platform economy, data science and insights.  
      • Strong understanding and application experience in any of the following emerging technologies:
        • Digital platforms/ecosystems: Next generation OSS, BSS and Others
        • Platform economy, transaction and innovation platform business models
        • Multi-cloud/Hyperscalers
        • Blockchain
        • Automated Intelligence and Machine Learning
        • Data and Visual Insights
        • Micro-Services/API as a service 
        • Others: 5G, Secure Access Service Edge, Mobile Edge Computing, SD-WAN, cybersecurity and NFV and IoT
      • Proven leadership in business development for horizontal and vertical market needs.

item.title: Design Specialist II - Geospatial Analytics
item.description:
Description

Join our team

 

The RAN planning and GIS team are a group of highly motivated engineers and business analysts who have a passion for developing and instigating wireless strategy across multiple engineering, implementation and business units. The team is responsible for aligning budgets, organizing work flow and clearing roadblocks amongst numerous partners to ensure the successful planning and rollout of wireless build programs, nationally. Overseeing a broad range of investment drivers, the team leverages big data analytics and geospatial analysis to refine business cases to bring forward new wireless build program investments across Canada.

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. With the increasing complexity of radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology you will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning, but also build a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Design Specialist with an area of focus on geospatial analytics, you will contribute by developing and implementing key tools and databases in the cloud environment for business intelligence equipping the team to drive and support the future of our network build in this evolving 5G environment. You will be in the forefront of not only driving efficiency but the potential for innovation is endless.

 

Here\'s how


•    Spearhead continued improvements of tools and processes and fuel innovation by leveraging automation and data science techniques
•    Database administration and design
•    Support ETL & big data processes
•    Software development
•    Utilizing Agile methodologies
•    Working with API integrations

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Experience with GIS Spatial data or mapping software
•    Experience with coding/scripting language like Python
•    Experience working in cloud environment like GCP, AWS, CI/CD GitOps
•    Experience with database management.
•    MSSQL, MYSQL, Postgres, Oracle, Big Data, Big Query, Spatial SQL
•    Experience with web development, HTML, Javascript (React)
•    Ability to effectively configure, process and analyze data
•    Detail oriented and analytical thinker
•    Committed to continuous learning and innovation
•    With a Bachelor of Computer Science and/or equivalent related degree

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Has some knowledge in 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    Familiarity with SPLUNK, Tableau, Alteryx, BluePrism, QGIS
•    Proficiency in Google Workspace

item.title: Senior Consultant - Community Platforms & Sustainability (Emerging Technology)
item.description:
#LI-Remote

Join our Team 

 

Interested in inventing the future?


 
You’re part of a team that will shape the evolution of communication, technology and value add services and help our clients stay connected to the people and things that matter to them most. The Sr. Consultant, Community Platforms & Sustainability focused on Emerging Technology is responsible for supporting the innovation, incubation and solution development of key next-wave technologies that we need to position to the market. 

 

At TELUS, we are looking for people that like solving big problems in a team based organizational structure. We believe that our shared success is as much about what you bring to the table everyday as it is about your skills and qualifications. Smart, motivated people that work well in teams can move mountains!

 

TELUS is a great place to work. You can see it in our team members. The diversity of the TELUS team and their unique contributions set us apart from the competition. Our success is based as much on our future friendly team as the innovative internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer to consumer and the business markets.

 

Our team members include people like you - enthusiastic, innovative, passionate and energetic. We believe that you’ll find our high-performance culture personally fulfilling, professionally challenging and financially rewarding. 


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

As the Senior Consultant for Emerging Technology PLT focused on Community Platforms & Sustainability with a focus on commercialization, you will provide technical and services development expertise to support outcome development for the B2B organization - utilizing new technologies to evolving digital solutions. The core emphasis for this role is a marketplace/business platform ecosystem creation. There is also a key need for expertise in using sustainability-focused capabilities.  You will also work with our CTO, sales, internal stakeholders to develop business opportunities for the company. 

You\'re the ideal candidate with:

  • Strong background and expertise in Community Platform development (multi-network development, differentiation, and co-innovation) - planning and engineering in end to end, or disruptive supply and value chains. 
  • Strong background in marketplace platforms, business platforms (transactional and innovation platforms).
  • Strong consulting background on strategy, business and services development on Sustainability Solutions (strong entrepreneurial, commercialization background – focus is market outcomes development)
  • Strong Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) background: Strategy, Planning and Implementation
  • Strong Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) background: Strategy, Planning and Implementation
  • Strong background on sustainability solutions market incubation, innovation and commercialization.
  • Strong background in circular economy monetization and commercialization.
  • Strong consulting, solution development competencies in various technologies, services and industries. Emphasis on 3rd wave and Industry 4.0 solutions. 
  • Proven experience in business and enterprise architecture and design
  • Proven entrepreneurial mindset in the creation of solutions and translation to market products and services (business outcome/market sensitive)
  • Very strong background in platform economy, data science and insights.  
  • Strong understanding and application experience in some if not all of the following emerging technologies:
    • Digital platforms/ecosystems: Next generation OSS, BSS and Others
    • Platform economy, transaction and innovation platform business models
    • Multi-cloud/Hyperscalers
    • Blockchain
    • Automated Intelligence and Machine Learning
    • Data and Visual Insights
    • Micro-Services/API as a service 
    • Others: 5G, Secure Access Service Edge, Mobile Edge Computing, SD-WAN, cybersecurity and NFV and IoT
  • Proven leadership in business development for horizontal and vertical market needs. 
  • Proven leadership in partner enablement and activation. 
  • Proven knowledge and leadership in vertical solution development and monetization.
  • Passion for excellence, strong work ethic and solutions-oriented


Your enthusiasm for learning and innovation, love of a challenge and leadership capabilities will be keys to your success.

 

    What you\'ll do in this role:

    • Develop solution based on emerging technologies to drive business/market outcome
    • Support innovation stream and incubation tactics to prove monetization and scaling of solutions 
    • Support solution selection through corporate investment maximization or validation through partner ecosystems
    • Support packaging solutions for segments, enable entry position for new/untapped markets 
    • Enable proactive benefits management 
    • Lead and influence high performance and collaboration in TELUS

     

     

    You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle:

    • At least 5+ years ESG, SDG and circular economy solutions development and commercialization.
    • At least 5+ years of technology and services consulting, solution and service development background.
    • At least 5+ years of experience in systems, data architecture applications.
    • At least 3+ years of experience in data science practice 
    • At least 3+ years of systems thinking, design thinking and UX background in solution development  
    • At least 5+ years of  strong frameworks knowledge and execution on pragmatic marketing, product management methodologies and processes
    • At least 5+ years, of financial analysis and business case development experience, strategy development methodologies. 
    • At least 5+ years, of strong background in IT architecture, delivery and operations. 
    • At least 5+ years, of strong IT Service Management practice experience: multi-tech and multi-organizational design competencies. 
    • At least 5+ years, Solid ITIL, TMF, TOGAF and PMP and Agile Product and Project Management background 
    • Have ISSP (Sustainability Excellence Associate or Sustainability Excellence Professional) certification.
    • Strong knowledge of wireless / fixed broadband, Telecom and non-Telecom IT applications, systems, platforms and services
    • Engineering, IT or related technical degree with MBA preferred, or MBA with strong technical background and demonstrated experience/competence working with IP, wireless and related technologies, or 5+ years business background in a technology industry with relevant experience in a product management or development role.


    What we give back to you:

    • Opportunities to excel and show your stuff – work on high value and high visibility projects – this is one of the top priorities within the TELUS Business Solutions team
    • Flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office 
    • Work in an organization that actively supports your personal development with leading edge training and development tools
    • An environment that lets you be your best every day
    • Work in an organization that actively supports you giving back to the community you live in
    • Competitive pay & benefits 
    • A place that embraces our core values: 
      • Spirited team work
      • Courage to innovate
      • Embrace change
      • Initiate opportunity and a Passion for growth

item.title: Senior Technical Product Manager - TELUS Business Solutions Emerging Technology Product Team
item.description:

Interested in inventing the future?

 

You’re part of a team that will shape the evolution of communication, technology and value add services and help our clients stay connected to the people and things that matter to them most. item.title: Data Scientist - Data Analytics
item.description:
Description


Join our team

 

Our Team – TELUS Business Solutions Marketing BI - has a mandate to build solutions for our stakeholders using data to drive business outcomes.  We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience.

 

Come join our team if you have a passion for data, analytics, marketing, the courage to innovate, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Data Scientist in the team, you will be working with Business Stakeholders and the campaign team to identify use cases, build machine learning models to protect the customer base, acquire new customers and to enable intelligent marketing campaigns.  Your solutions will have a direct impact on marketing sales targets and P&L.

 

Here’s how

 

  • You will build pipelines to bring data required to support the use case
  • You will develop new machine learning models to enable intelligent campaigns
  • You will productionalize machine learning models and automate processes
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to enable new use cases for TELUS Business
  • Effectively communicate with leadership and stakeholders in explaining the model and outcomes

Qualifications


You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You have experience leading large scale projects and  partnering with multiple stakeholders
  • You can manage ambiguity and change with a learning and growth mindset
  • You love digging into quantitative and qualitative data
  • You have experience working with customer data, building recommendation engines, personalized offer management, lifetime value and propensity modeling
  • You have experience in building machine learning algorithms 
  • You have worked with R/Python, SQL, spark, big data technologies or cloud
  • You have data engineering experience and ability to extract data from various sources
  • You have 5+ years of experience in a similar role and/or related education with demonstrated performance


Great to haves

 

  • Prior telecommunications or B2B marketing experience
  • Experience with Cloud / Salesforce technologies

item.title: Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Architect
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 
The Network Architecture and Convergence is a newly created, innovative team that is also responsible for cross-domain network architecture development covering cloud orchestration, network slicing, automation and assurance, data analytics and network exposure with holistic architecture alignment;  in addition to wireless/wireline convergence covering access, network, policy, subscriber data, provisioning and charging. With the fast evolving 5G ecosystem driven by rapid technological, regulatory, and customer demand changes, the level of uncertainty and complexity of this transformation is increasing. Still, the opportunities are greater today than ever before for industry players like TELUS. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth by leveraging the latest technologies  

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


You are a machine learning and artificial intelligence solution architect who prides yourself on leading digital transformation by introducing latest technology  of artificial intelligence and machine learning models. You truly believe in the adoption of IT and cloud orchestration and automation, and data analytics to drive intelligent network operation that enables the efficient and creative growth of wireless and wireline networks, while reducing costs. Finally, your passion and initiative in translating and applying your learnings in wireless and wireline communication networks will propel TELUS’ digital transformation.

 

Here’s how


•    You will lead the cross domain ML/AI enabler architecture, strategy, design, and align with automation, 5G network slicing, cloud, and 5G network 
•    You will develop/design ML/AI reference architecture framework applied to Radio, core, transport, service and cloud (hyper scaler) domains, to enable truly artificial intelligent network with machine learning capability
•    Through collaboration with multiple teams, you will drive innovation in automation, artificial intelligence, and big data analytics
•    Create business cases to secure necessary capital for overall ML/AI reference architecture  
•    You will work with other senior architects in order to identify the existing gaps in the network  to get fully automated network with predicative model by Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
•    You will develop and analyze RFP’s to introduce new platforms and system to get fully automated network 
•    You will manage the vendor relationship once established on behalf of TELUS
•    You will develop the ML/AI enabler roadmap with the collaboration with other teams 
•    You will plan, execute and report on strategic trials in the lab with collaboration with other teams across TELUS 
 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Machine learning open source frame work  (PyTorch, JAX and NumPy,TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Pandas etc.)
•    Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Kafka, Kinesis, Hadoop, Big Query, DataFlow, Pub/Sub, etc
•    5+ years of relevant IT Architecture experience, advanced technical and analytical skills, and the ability to take responsibility for the overall technical direction of the project
•    Knowledgeable in one or more development/scripting languages and orchestration/API tools  (Java, YAML, Shell, Json, Python, Keras etc.)
•    Advanced knowledge in SQL and Apache Spark
•    Well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
•    Knowledge of 5G network protocols and experience with network management are pluses especially 3GPP standard (NWDAF and MDAF)
•    Expert knowledge of the software project lifecycle—from concept through design to implementation and test.
•    Proven track record of leading data analytics, 5G SA and automation projects
•    Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
•    Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
•    Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
•    A Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, Master’s preferred
 
Great-to-haves

 

•    5+ years of telecommunications experience
•    Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures
•    Architecture and design experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)/OpenShift Container Platform (OCP)/Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or Azure products
•    Experience with containerization tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, and/or OpenStack technology and networking (CNI, Calico, Multus, VxLAN, vSwitch etc
•    Skilled in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools, i.e. Spinnaker, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GCP Cloud Build,  Jupyter etc

item.title: Engineer II - Ran Development
item.description:
Description

Position Overview:
 
Working with TELUS Technology Strategy teammates, stakeholders, and vendors, the successful candidate will be responsible for LTE and 5G RAN technology design and development, solution optimization, and provide technical support for Broadband Network P&E teams inside TELUS. The candidate must possess solid knowledge of LTE & 5G products, 3GPP specs, RF design and optimization and is willing to take challenges to deal with customer service impacting issues.
 
Responsibilities:
 
The successful candidate will join the Wireless Access Architecture Team within Technology Strategy by taking the following responsibilities: 
 
•    Responsible for LTE and 5G RAN network hardware, software and feature new technology introduction
•    Proactively Communicate/clarify TELUS requirements to vendors and evaluates responses
•    Translate LTE/5G technical aspects into business impact and vice versa, plus E2E integration requirement  
•    Propose solutions and features optimization engineering guidelines, provide support for field teams
•    Plan the execution of TELUS strategy and get involved in the execution 
•    Validate vendor compliance to industry/TELUS standards and the functional and performance requirements by conducting lab proof of concept and interoperability testing with other systems, etc.
•    Communicate and present cross-team to explain the technical decisions and their outcomes
•    Keep well informed of the latest wireless technology developments relating to the field of practice 

Qualifications

Required Knowledge:


•    Solid knowledge on LTE/5G RF design and optimization (5+ years’ experience), Proficient in RF propagation and modeling, interference and link budget analysis, and network infrastructure (Macro cell, Micro cell, Pico cell,) and protocols (i.e. TCP/IP).
•    Understand future network technology evolution: HeNet (small cell), AI & Machine learning, MEC, 5G Network slicing, and SDN/virtualization, Cloud technology …
•    Familiar with 3GPP spec., including air interface implementation, RRM, MM, and RF compliance.
•    Understand basic knowledge of IP, Video streaming, Multicast, and other networking protocols,
•    Hands-on experience with the network/performance testing tools such as IXIA, SmartBits, Chariot, QXDM, Agilent drive testing tool, XCAL, TEMS, and Actix tool IP based application knowledge and exposure to network security would also be assets 
•    5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plan for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users
•    Ability to provide on demand, specialized technical advice for the technical solution of a number of wide ranging problems and to interact with others including on a proactive customer focused basis
•    Familiar with wireless network trouble shooting procedure and performance enhancement process with knowledge related 


Required Skills and Abilities:


•    Excellent English oral and written communication skills
•    Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives 
•    Strong team and collaborative skills, ability to lead/perform in a team environment
•    High level of personal energy and willingness to take the initiative in planning and organizing daily work
•    Sets high personal standards of performance and is capable of adapting to changes in priorities, work assignments and schedules in a dynamic environment
•    Good judgment in discerning between priority and non-priority issues
•    Sets and achieves challenging work goals for self (i.e. professionalism, self-motivated, ambitious, reliable, accurate, courteous)
•    Strong desire to acquire and apply new skills in a constantly evolving highly technical environment
•    Demonstrates strong sense of urgency and drives issues to closure
•    Proficient in the use and application of PC-based applications (i.e. MS Office suite: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio)


 
Required Professional Designation/Certification:


•    Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or an equivalent 
 
Required Experience:

 

5+ years’ experience in wireless communication industry

item.title: Data Scientist (Montreal, Toronto or remote position) - TELUS Health
item.description:
Description

 

TELUS Health Solutions is an IT leader in Canada which focuses on the health sector. We develop and manage solutions that automate transactions and the secure exchange of information to increase the process efficiency and quality of service our customers enjoy.

 

Our mission is to improve the way information is used along the continuum of care to better the health of citizens in Canada and in selected countries.

 

At TELUS Health Solutions, we are as driven to take on new challenges as you are. Join one of Canada\'s leading IT providers and help us take our work—and your career—to the next level.

 

Responsibilities

 

The Data Scientist combines expertise of advanced data analytics strategies and technologies to systematically extract, compile and develop vast amount of unstructured data from multi-channels and sources. Required to create quantitative models to generate insights and actionable opportunities to increase revenue, reduce operating costs and drive growth. The Data Scientist is able to tell the story effectively and influence how TELUS Health approaches their business challenges and opportunities.

 

  • Research and evaluate advanced quantitative models to predict customer behaviours and generate actionable insights for product & service enhancements.
  • Research and develop metrics that measure the impact of customer strategies and addresses complex business challenges. Leverage innovative technologies and rigorous methods to extract, analyze, evaluate and interpret complex, multi-dimensional and constantly changing data.
  • Present findings and actionable solutions to business leaders, product design specialists, marketing professionals and sales team members.
  • Lead the design of new frameworks and metrics for answering complex business questions, drive strategic decisions and influence go to market strategies across all customer segments.
  • Ensure continuous improvement by leading the development and coding of software programs and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate datasets from multiple disparate sources.
  • Design and implement quality procedures for developing new data and build continual learning systems. Oversee the development and coding of software programs and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate data from multiple and disparate sources.
  • As the expert in data modeling and analysis, provide technical coaching and mentoring to team members to ensure appropriate accessing and handling of data. Provide technical coaching and mentoring to team members to ensure appropriate accessing, managing and interpretation of data

 

 

Qualifications

Required knowledge & experience:

 

  • Minimum 10 years experience using data extraction and processing technologies to build advanced predictive models.
  • Experience with group insurance, group benefits, and/or PBM operations preferred
  • Knowledge in evaluating and applying statistical and predictive models including constructing algorithms such as decision trees, regression, clustering, association, etc.
  • Knowledge in database querying, data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence and relational database design.
  • Fluent in programming languages: SQL, R, Python, Java, SPSS, SASS.
  • Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner with both technical and non-technical team members.
  • Research and problem solving skills. Able to learn new concepts and methodologies and quickly apply them to new problem solving scenarios.
  • Highly motivated with a tendency to question existing assumptions and processes.
  • Ability to work in a collaborative, entrepreneurial environment on high impact problems. Able to provide actionable solutions to complex business challenges.

 

Professional accreditation or certification:

 

  • Masters or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Engineering or other quantitative disciplines.

item.title: Strategy Manager
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

TELUS is looking for a passionate and talented leader to join a highly skilled, dynamic advanced analytics team. You will collaborate and work with a team of data scientists responsible for developing robust models for predicting call center demand used to inform the wireline and wireless Customer Experience budget, strategic plans and monthly Triage activities. You will use your expert communication collaborating with various stakeholders from budgeting, operations, marketing, and project teams to drive alignment on key metrics, process efficiencies and develop data-driven insights and stories

 

Customer Experience AI, Data and Analytics Spotlight:

 

  • Our team works in a fun, innovative and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Customer Experience business
  • Our teams are responsible for the Demand Forecasting, Customer Intents, Behavioral Prediction, and Performance Analytics
  • We work closely with stakeholder teams to deliver on our strategic objectives; our key stakeholders and partners include Operations, Marketing, Finance, and Technology

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Strong Business Acumen and storytelling skills
  • Outstanding people leadership skills with a keen focus on developing and fostering an innovative and engaged culture
  • A strong background or knowledge of forecasting, statistics, data analytics, machine learning
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills, ability to work with various levels of management up to and including Senior Management as well as work within multi-functional teams
  • Resourcefulness to identify opportunities and drive change with a sense of urgency
  • Ability to understand and integrate all internal and external drivers (i.e.: Finance, Economics, Operations, etc.) that impact problem solving and decision making
  • Ability to maintain a positive attitude despite high-pressure situations and manage multiple priorities within tight deadlines
  • Ability to be flexible and drive to resolution in a fast-paced and changing environment
  • Ability to provide and execute on actionable recommendations based on data analysis
  • Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner with non-technical team members
  • Working knowledge of process improvement methodologies

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Proficient with Microsoft Office software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Experience with Google Office Suite (Sheets, Docs, Slides) would be an asset
  • Experience with statistical programing software such as Python would be an asset
  • Experience with SQL would be an asset
  • Strong knowledge of call center operations
  • University degree and/or 3-5 years equivalent combination of experience and education
  • CPA, MBA or MSc would be considered an asset

item.title: 5G Network and Data Analytics specialist
item.description:
Join our team!

 

The Network Strategy & Unified Planning team within the Chief Technology Office (CTO) is on a continuous journey to help TELUS build a world-class 5G network for our customers and unlock new monetization opportunities to grow our business. Our mission is to drive integrated wireless network strategy enabling and aligning TELUS to deliver the next generation of 5G services while continuing to retain network leadership. We are passionate about putting our customers first as we are building innovative capabilities and services that are based on software and becoming the best digital services provider in the market.

 

 

Here\'s the impact you\'ll make and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

As a 5G Network and Data Analytics specialist within the broader Wireless Network Strategy team you’ll be at the center of the development of our 5G network strategies enabling TELUS to win against our competitors and delivering the next generation of 5G services for our customers. You will leverage your deep technical knowledge of 5G technologies and automation/data science combined with your strategic thinking to help shape the future of TELUS’ award-winning wireless network and advance our 5G technology roadmaps to enable new use cases. Your passion for technology, business acumen and collaborative leadership will help you foster relationships with multiple business units to ensure strong alignment across technology roadmaps, services and business outcomes driving profitable growth for our organization.

 

Here\'s how

  • Develop data analytics to create competitive network insights that will proactively influence our 5G network strategies and roadmaps
  • Apply data mining methodologies to tap into rich data sources and support fact-based, data-driven decision making
  • Spearhead continued improvements of tools and processes by leveraging automation and data science techniques
  • Articulate roadmaps and network capabilities in a compelling way to help marketing teams develop innovative 5G products and services
  • Participate in the analysis and evaluation of proposed specific use cases: economic, technology, return on investment, sensitivity
  • Prepare and deliver presentations to the executive team on key strategic opportunities and updates
  • Cultivate strong, collaborative partnerships with stakeholders, including DevOps, program management, product development, finance and communications teams to drive strategic alignment  

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • 5+ years of experience as part of a Wireless Network Planning and Engineering (including 3GPP radio access network planning -5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA)
  • 3+ years of experience with Data Analytics (including data modeling, data engineering & big data, processing and analyzing high volume, unstructured data) and automation
  • Excellent strategic analysis with strong business and financial acumen
  • Excellent relationship building and negotiation skills required to obtain commitment from cross-functional teams to support and deliver on priorities
  • Strong written and verbal presentation and communication skills
  • Programming experience in Python, SQL databases and understanding of NoSQL databases
  • Understanding of GIS (Geographic information systems)

 

Great-to-haves

  • MBA or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Visualization tools such as Tableau/Splunk is an asset
  • Experience with active participation in complex project strategy and execution
  • Experience in the end-to-end network capital planning cycle
  • Experience working in cloud environment i.e. GCP

Note: This is a REMOTE opportunity

#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Senior Technology Architect - Data Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team
 
The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing. 
We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.
 
 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 
 

Here’s how

 

  • Build data pipelines, provision infrastructure and secure reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP
  • Analyze data, build models and generate reports and visualization using Hadoop and Cloud infrastructure
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modelling
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning Spark applications
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems (MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra, HBase, Redis, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark or others)
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • You are experienced with Apache, its ecosystem and relevant tools (Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, Avro)
  • You are familiar SQL-on- technologies (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

 

Nice to have

 

 

  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • DevOps practices and tools experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience

item.title: Intermediate/Senior Software Developer - 5G Services DevOps Team
item.description:
Description

 

Make your mark on the leading edge of next generation wireless networks and technologies!
 
Join our team
 
The Service Delivery Framework (SDF) gives the ability to connect API consumers with API owners, enabling the creation of thousands of applications by TELUS teams and 3rd parties. Being able to support a broad range of applications from customer self-care to health to messaging to emergency response to fleet management to charitable giving and beyond, SDF plays a foundational role for TELUS to participate in the digital economy.
 
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
 
This is an opportunity for you to drive the software development for our core network infrastructure and services. Your creativity coupled with strong software development, automation, data science, and computer networking skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building and maintaining our API gateway platform to a variety of types of services from network capabilities to health services to support existing mobility infrastructure and offer new services.
 
You will exercise your entrepreneurial spirit and creative vision to change the way TELUS leverages technology. Collectively, the passion we have to transform the Network landscape will remain a leading factor in why customers continue to recognize TELUS as the fastest and most reliable network in Canada.


 
Here’s how


●    Create new solutions while working as part of our existing Agile Development Team with a good focus on quality, automated testing and reliability
●    Develop quality solutions through adherence to coding standards and test automation on our Enterprise API Gateway Solution
●    New technology implementation and agile development
●    Identify potential process improvement areas, suggest options and recommend solutions
●    Develop new features and implement design improvements 
●    Participate in creation of technical design documentation: Detail design & architecture documents
●    Participate in operational improvement initiatives, in conjunction with other technology teams in the company
●    Strong communication skills with the ability to present to stakeholders at Sprint Demo meetings

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle


●    With a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering
●    Valued for your 5+ years of relevant professional experience as a Software Developer
●    Skilled in of one or many of the following languages: Java, JavaScript, Lua, XSLT, Python
●    Knowledge of HTTP, HTTP/2
●    Recognized for your network systems and process automation experience using programming/scripting languages and experience with DevOps tools such as Ansible, Jenkins, GitLAB and Splunk
●    Working in collaborative agile development teams, with experience working with CI/CD pipelines and activities.
●    Ability to develop automated unit and integration tests
●    Passionate about API design, development and documentation
●    Analyzes application and API performance, evaluates alternatives, provides estimates and makes recommendations
●    Experience with Security frameworks including JWT, OATH2
●    Experience with Unix, Linux Operating Systems.
●    Known for your experience working on cloud computing platforms including AWS (EC2, RDS, Lambda, SNS, SQS)

 

Great-to-haves

 

●    Understanding of SOAP APIs, converting web services from SOAP to REST
●    Strong TCP/IP skills 
●    Ability to search and discover issues and trends using Splunk
●    Experience using and developing for Kong API Gateway, IBM DataPower, F5 Load Balancers, MongoDB and LDAP

item.title: Administrative Coordinator - 12 Month Contract
item.description:
Available Locations
Toronto

What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic candidate to fill our Administrative Coordinator role on a 12 month contract.  With responsibilities spanning across all four of our offices, this role will support Borealis AI in all day-to-day administrative duties ranging from on- and off-boarding employees, to coordinating events, to providing seamless office support.  As a member of the Operations team, you will be joining a group that believes in being Bold & Curious, so we are looking for someone who is creative, eager to learn and looking to make an impact! 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Borealis-AI-wide administrative support, such as on- and off-board employees and contractors, form submittals, asset management, ordering supplies, and shipping packages.

  • Provide support to Head of Borealis AI in managing their calendar, booking travel, and filing expense reports.

  • Coordinate Borealis AI team and office events;

  • Contribute to the implementation of operational improvements in order to streamline processes;

  • Maintain the condition and operating efficiency of the Toronto & Waterloo offices and arrange for supplies and general upkeep.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • Recent graduate in business administration, business management or relevant experience;

  • 1-2 years relevant office coordination experience;

  • Keen interest in logistics, office management, and administration;

  • Strong interpersonal relationship skills;

  • Ability to work efficiently and accurately with minimal supervision;

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills;

  • Ability to multitask and prioritize workload to meet deadlines.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Business Development Lead - Capital Markets
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for a critical problem solver who’s eager to help our machine learning research team deliver competitive products for RBC Capital Markets. As a member of our Business Engagement and Strategy team, you’ll be responsible for identifying exciting artificial intelligence research opportunities that will create outsized value for one of the bank’s lines of business. You’ll engage with our partners in the bank to develop strategic business plans to apply AI technologies to real-world problems, and you’ll collaborate with our product team to align business and technical stakeholders.

 

Our ideal candidate has an extensive working knowledge of capital markets and/or machine learning applications in finance, strong executive communication skills, and 2-5 years experience working in a financial institution. At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, as well as front office teams in Capital Markets. Our mission is to think big and go beyond what’s possible today to deliver competitive AI products. This is a rare opportunity to build the skills required to make machine learning work in the enterprise. You can find out more about our research areas at www.borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Becoming the Borealis AI expert on one or more RBC business lines;
  • Building relationships with RBC executives, subject matter experts, and technical teams;
  • Representing the business vision in the group’s product engagements and educating researchers on business needs;
  • Understanding Borealis AI research areas and creatively mapping technologies onto business problems;
  • Building and communicating strategic business plans, and collaborating with the Borealis AI research and product teams to ensure alignment, feasibility, and success; and
  • Defining and documenting business requirements and collaborating with the product and research teams to establish product scopes, test technical feasibility, and resolve any business issues that arise during product development.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Have front office experience in Capital Markets, Portfolio Management or a related field
  • Have working knowledge of data analytics and machine learning or a willingness to learn;
  • Have experience aligning new technologies to existing ones in large enterprises’ processes;
  • Have experience working in financial institutions;
  • Have experience developing relationships with senior and junior stakeholders at large enterprises;
  • Have experience developing business cases and other communications on technology projects;
  • Are a creative thinker who can develop long-term strategies as well as a stickler for detail on short-term commitments and deliverables;
  • Are excited to work with a machine learning research team on solving problems that cannot be solved with existing technology.

What’s in it for you?

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an experienced Dev/Ops Support Engineer who will bring focus and subject-matter expertise around designing, implementing and supporting machine learning infrastructure and automation tools in production. This is a unique opportunity to grow in the world of machine learning infrastructure and work with a team of passionate individuals committed to the mission of bringing ML to enterprise.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Providing production support and maintenance for ML applications;
  • Designing, building, and optimizing machine learning deployment tools and automation systems that operate the business’s data and ML applications;
  • Collaborating with engineers, and machine learning researchers to automate code analysis, build, integration and deployment of ML applications;
  • Supporting applications and projects with infrastructure design decisions, and monitoring solutions;
  • Building highly scalable, resilient cloud and on-premise systems for hosting machine learning systems using state-of-the-art technologies;;
  • Providing after-hours production support.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • Strong experience with Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps and production support;
  • Strong and relevant experience supporting and maintaining distributed systems;
  • Hands-on experience building and deploying virtualized environments in major cloud environments, such as Kubernetes, AWS and Azure;
  • Experience with building tools and applications to automate various infrastructure tasks (Jenkins, etc.);
  • Proficiency with programming languages such as Python, Bash, or JavaScript;

item.description:

Toronto

As a Group Product Manager on the Product team, you’ll get a chance to lead a portfolio of innovative AI products for the financial services industry and lead a team of machine learning product managers. You and your team will be responsible for building and delivering products that solve high-impact business and for defining strategic product roadmaps for your portfolio with the support of the business development, engineering, and research teams.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading machine learning researchers and software developers.
